awd_titl_txt: Robust and Efficient High Order Methods for Time Dependent Problems
awd_abstract_narration:
Robust and efficient high order accurate methods for computation have gained more and more popularity in the numerical modeling of real world problems for their ability to produce high fidelity simulations. However, such methods are not available or not well understood for hydrodynamics equations modeling high speed flows in spacecraft design, combustion, detonation, astrophysical jets, hurricanes, tsunamis, plasma dynamics, and inertial confinement fusion. This research project aims to develop improved numerical methods for simulation of these systems.  Progress in designing robust and more efficient high order methods will significantly impact on simulation technology for such applications.  

The state of high order accurate numerical methods is still far from being practically satisfactory for time-dependent nonlinear problems. Compared to their low order counterparts, high order methods are much harder to stabilize and might be less efficient in practice due to much larger computer memory cost. Thus it remains challenging to utilize a high order accurate method to solve nonlinear hydrodynamics equations in real world problems. The objective of this proposal is to address these real-world problem challenges from specific perspectives. First of all, one would like to ensure the robustness of Eulerian schemes by preserving certain invariances of physical quantities such as positivity. Second, one would like to design more efficient implementations of very high order schemes on curved elements for complex geometries.

por.por_cntn:
The main objective of this project is to construct robust high order accurate schemes for demanding convection diffusion problems such as compressible Navier-Stokes equations in gas dynamics. For many popular low order accurate schemes, monotonicity property can be proven thus it is straightforward to achieve bound-preserving or positivity-preserving property, such as positivity of density and pressure in gas dynamics, which can ensure nonlinear stability thus robustness. In general, high order accurate schemes are not monotone. However, monotonicity can still holds in a weak sense in certain type of high order accurate schemes. The major outcome of this project consists of several new robust high order accurate schemes in which bound-preserving or positivity-preserving is achieved by exploring weak monotonicity. In particular, fourth, sixth and eighth order accurate compact finite difference schemes have been shown weakly monotone for scalar equations, and so far they are the only class of linear high order schemes that can be proven weakly monotone. Another major result published in 2017 is that arbitrarily high order discontinuous Galerkin scheme can be rendered positivity-preserving by using a novel nonlinear diffusion flux in compressible Navier-Stokes equations in gas dynamics, achieving robustness for simulating high speed flows which usually results in low density and low pressure, e.g., simulating diffraction of a Mach 10 shock. This is the very first high order accurate method to preserve positivity of density and pressure for compressible Navier-Stokes equations.
